mobs.long_desc: Ziijhan, the Defiler, floats here with his head bowed, in silence.
mobs.desc: The man who floats before you is Ziijhan, the Defiler.  His black heart contains so much evil and hatred that he absorbs the light surrounding him, making him almost impossible to see.  He is completely unadorned, a simple coarse black hooded cloak hides his face from yours.  There are rumors that the most powerful Anti-Paladins have the ability to cause harm with a simple touch. Rewarded for his treachery, Ziijhan has been given an unimaginable amount of power from the demon realm.

mobs.long_desc: A dire wolf stands here snarling, guarding her territory.
mobs.desc: This is like no wolf you have ever seen.  She stands about four feet tall at the shoulders, with teeth like daggers.  Very muscular with a dark gray and black coat, her eyes glow green.

mobs.long_desc: A gargoyle bursts in through the window.
mobs.desc: A grotesque creation spawned from deep in the recesses of the human psyche, this horror bears little resemblance to a human.  It stands only four feet tall.  Its teeth are numerous, razor sharp, and two rows deep.  Its ears are pointed, reminiscent of elven race.  The gargoyle is fashioned from solid black rock, that is common in the surrounding hills.

mobs.long_desc: A statue lunges at you from its alcove.
mobs.desc: Standing about six feet in height, and bearing some likeness to a human, this free standng statue, carved from solid rock, guards the cathedral against intruders.  It is carved in a very realistic fashion, right down to the rivets on his breastplate and sleeves.

mobs.long_desc: An undead priestess glares at you with lifeless eyes.
mobs.desc: With long, stringy, gray hair and a frail old frame, this woman would be best described as being quite haggard.  It is hard to say how old she is, but it must be a hundred years at least, maybe longer.

mobs.long_desc: The Evil Ghast stands here.
mobs.desc: This undead creature, once human, now feeds on the flesh of corpses.  Its face is missing a good deal of flesh, its clothes are torn, and it carries a tremendously bad odor with it.  Even though the change from human to ghast has deranged his mind, he is terribly cunning and dangerous.

mobs.long_desc: A walking corpse stands here.
mobs.desc: Well dressed in garb long forgotten by people and time, this person has been disturbed from his eternal sleep.  His skin is peeling away in places, and his feet are only bone.  The stench brings a tear to your eye.

mobs.long_desc: A sinner is kneeling here in penance.
mobs.desc: A semi-transparent apparition kneels here in silence.  Although she is only dressed in tattered rags, she appears to be beautiful, and must have been in her early twenties when she died.  She seems disturbed by your intrusion.

mobs.long_desc: An Acolyte stands here awaiting his cues.
mobs.desc: Standing vigilantly, this young acolyte still waits for his cues to spring into action.  This acolyte is very young, not even a teenager yet.  He knows not the trials and sorrows of being an adult.  No wrinkles or facial hair taints his face.  His rosy cheeks, blonde hair, and bright blue eyes make him seem extremely innocent and not very threatening.

mobs.long_desc: A shadow creeps slowly along the walls and floor.
mobs.desc: Featureless and black, the shadow is not bound to this reality, as it dances across the ceiling.  It darts in and out of sight as it blends in with the background and the darkness.

mobs.long_desc: A heavy Fog obstructs vision and movement.
mobs.desc: Covering the entire room and engulfing you fully, this grey colored fog seems to be comprised of the deep hatred, which resides in this cathedral.  At certain times different parts of the fog coalesce into a demonic face.

mobs.long_desc: A behemoth of a man stands guard here.
mobs.desc: This humanoid stands more then nine feet in height.  His face is hidden behind a mask.  His neck and arms are as thick as tree trunks, and his chest bulges with muscles.  His eyes, pitch black, stare out with cold calculation.

mobs.long_desc: A Hooded figure snickers at your advancement.
mobs.desc: Well over ten feet tall, this giant looks tremendously strong, yet he moves nimbly about the room.  His face is terribly disfigured and scarred.  He has a strange grin on his face, as if he takes a great deal of pleasure from his trade.

mobs.long_desc: The deposed bishop is here weeping softly, shackled to the wall.
mobs.desc: Still as young as the day she was imprisioned, this pretty, red haired bishop is now dirty, bruised, and bleeding.  Her once beautiful, flowing white dress is now old and yellowed.  In her eyes is still a tremendous amout of life and spirit though, that refuses to be extinguished.

mobs.long_desc: A lonely old man is here seemingly unaware of your approach.
mobs.desc: This old man's eye sockets are hollow, and on occasion a worm or bug crawls out.  He is dressed in a coarse, black, hooded robe and his wiry, gray hair sticks out haphazardly from his head.  He is quite frail, and conducts himself in a strange manner.

mobs.long_desc: A small, wrinkled man is here with a crazy look in his eye.
mobs.desc: He looks at you with a great deal of suspicion. He looks to be a thousand years old, maybe older. Being as frail as he seems, maybe you should just leave him be, in peace.

mobs.long_desc: A demonic bat flaps around in the air here.
mobs.desc: This bat has a twisted face and beady eyes.  The wing-span of the demonic creature is quite vast, stretching just over a meter.  The body is plump, looking as though the bat never misses a good meal.  The fur on the back of its neck points up, and overshadows a ring shaped indentation encircling it.

mobs.keywords: statue stone large large-statue stone-statue north
mobs.long_desc: A large statue of marble stands to the north.
mobs.desc: This large statue stands here.  His stone is thick and solid, the marble unflawed.  He stands here guarding the north exit of this place.

mobs.keywords: statue stone large large-statue stone-statue west
mobs.long_desc: A large statue of marble stands to the west.
mobs.desc: This large statue stands here.  His stone is thick and solid, the marble unflawed.  He stands here guarding the west exit of this place.

mobs.keywords: statue stone large large-statue stone-statue south
mobs.long_desc: A large statue of marble stands to the south.
mobs.desc: This large statue stands here.  His stone is thick and solid, the marble unflawed.  He stands here guarding the south exit of this place.

mobs.long_desc: A small man in plain dress stands here.
mobs.desc: This small pilgrim has seen many days and many places.  His eyes are hidden back in his head, causing him to appear dark and mysterious, though he seems rather placid.  He stands with his hands thrust into pouches in his tunic, which is plain and uneventful.

mobs.long_desc: Norisent the Ancient stands here.
mobs.desc: Norisent the Ancient has hidden himself away for generations, even from the other clergy of the Cathedral of Betrayal.  Long ago, he was probably a human man, but now is more skeletal than mortal.  Only desiccated vestiges of skin cling to his bones, his organs long ago crumbled away.  Yet Norisent is no mere walking skeleton - he is a lich, a mighty Necromancer who has somehow stumbled on the secret of an unlife bolstered by the most arcane of magics.

mobs.long_desc: A dark shadow lingers on the north wall. It's probably nothing.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.

objects.ground: A small leatherbound book is here.

extras.text: This small, key-shaped book is a remarkable little work of art and literature. Too bad the writing is in an unfamiliar tongue.

objects.ground: A large tome sits here on a charred-black pedestal.

extras.text: You glance at the tome hoping to indulge yourself at the wisdom of the ages, but alas, you cannot understand the writings.

objects.ground: A glittering black cloak is here.

extras.text: A strangely powerful black cloak pulses with energy in your hand.  It is inlaid with tiny flecks of gold.

objects.ground: The head of Berack is lying here.

extras.text: This is the head of a very old man. A crazed expression is still on his wrinkled, toothless face. This head is very animated even in death. How strange.

objects.ground: A carved symbol lies here in the dirt.

extras.text: This carved symbol bears no inscriptions. It is a carving of a cross with a crescent moon resting horizonitally on the top

objects.ground: A tiny black earring rests here.

extras.text: This small silver earring features a shiny black cabuchon. Odd runes are carved into the stone.

objects.ground: A bronze censer sits here smoking slightly.

extras.text: This small bronze incense burner can be either held by a long handle, or allowed to stand on 3 small legs.  Smoke generally seeps out under its hood, smelling of heady incense, and as long as it burns incense, it will glow.  An uneven green patina ripples across its surface.

objects.ground: An uncomfortable looking shirt sits here unclaimed.

extras.text: This shirt is long-sleeved and high-necked, with a low hem.  It is made of incredibly coarse material, making it quite irritating to wear for any length of time.

objects.ground: A coarse black wimple lies rumpled here.

extras.text: Made of coarse homespun wool, this wimple conceals most of the head and neck, revealing the face, but little else.  It is simply designed, allowing one to wear it quickly and easily.

objects.ground: An highly decorated maniple sits here.

extras.text: This beautiful maniple is worn by priests only during the most sacred of occasions.

objects.ground: A sickle lies here gathering dust.

extras.text: This farm implement seems somehow more sinister than other sickles. Its shaft is made of wood, with two sections wrapped in thongs. The blade is quite long and similar in shape to a scimitar. It protrudes out from the shaft quite some distance, then rounds back towards it in a vicious curve. Overall, it seems like quite a clumsy weapon, but wielded properly, it could do great damage.

objects.ground: A sword made of pure black rock lies here.
A shield-shaped black stone lies here.

extras.text: Though this stone is exactly the size and shape of a tower shield, it is much heavier!  The stone used is black and somewhat porous, unornamented.  Straps on the back allow it to be worn on the arm.  The surface of this shield is not even nicked.

objects.ground: A large, heavy black axe lies here.

extras.text: This axe is huge, designed to be wielded in both hands, making it difficult to heft in battle.  Its shaft is made of some kind of black wood, wrapped along most of its length in black leather thong.  The vicious blade is made of blackened steel, with the half-moon-shaped edge of it protruding beyond the shaft for several inches.

objects.ground: A thick black leather hood rests here.

extras.text: This hood is made of black leather, and covers the head all the way to the shoulders, like a mantle.  The only part of the face that shows, through a pair of large holes, are the eyes.

objects.ground: A thick, thorned staff carved with runes has been tossed here.

extras.text: This long staff is made of some sort of dark wood that tapers from the top to the bottom, which is capped in black iron.  Two sections of its length are wrapped in leather strips, though the rest of it is covered in a regular arrangement of thick thorns.  The bulbous top of the staff is covered in them. This weapon, for weapon it must be, has a good weight and heft in the hand.

objects.ground: A red-hilted dagger lies unsheathed.

extras.text: This dagger has a long, slender, blackened metal blade.  The metal is quite similar to the ore found in hills near Ickle.  The hilt is made of a strange red stone that pulsates in the hand.  Though it is burnished to a sheen, it still offers a good grip.

objects.ground: A pool of metallic azure liquid shaped in the form of some unknown rune floats here.

extras.text: About one foot deep and filled with deep-blue metallic substance, this pool's shape is quite interesting to look at.  There appears to be an inscription on the side.
Tariak circa 1999...In memory to those who have passed on. -JHS

objects.ground: A small key made of metal lies here.

extras.text: This key is a simple, small bit of metal that has been shaped to fit a tiny, deep lock.  There is a small hole at the base for a chain or rope to hold it, and has a rune carved into one side.

objects.ground: A small glass case sits here on a small ledge.

extras.text: This case is made only of glass and a few bits of metal.  There is a small ring on the top, and a small lock holding the glass together.  There is room inside to hold something, but the black glass does not allow too wonderful of a view within.

objects.ground: A talisman lays on the ground here, with an aura of death around it.

extras.text: This talisman is the size of your hand.  A figurine of a peacefully dead man, prepared for burial.

objects.short: the Book of Death and Life
objects.ground: A small book is sprawled open on the floor, pages turning in the wind.

extras.text: There's something very special about this book.

triggers.name: ziijhan_welcome
triggers.commands: wait 2 switch %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'So you come crawling back.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Only the most cunning and strong will complete the &5quest&0 I set before you.  I shall take great pleasure in your demise, but I will offer great rewards for your success.' break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is time to hunt!' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'My pitiful waste of a &5brother&0 escaped my minions.' break case 3 case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Have you brought proof that my brother is not beyond my reach?' break default if %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 25 done elseif %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 35 done elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 45 done endif if %classgreet% == yes if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= %maxlevel% peer %actor.name% emote places a most vile half-smile on his face. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Some know not of their &5destinies&0, while others simply choose to ignore them.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Which of the two are you?' glare %actor.name% endif endif done if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% eval minlevel %macestep% * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I sense a ghostly presence about your weapons.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need?' endif endif endif

triggers.name: quest_preamble_ziijhan
triggers.commands: if %speech% /= destiny || %speech% /= destinies || %speech% /= I know if !%actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% if %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to anti-paladin.&0 halt endif break default set classquest 1 done elseif %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to diabolist.&0 halt endif break default set classquest 1 done elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to necromancer.&0 halt endif break default set classquest 1 done else if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sorry, I cannot help you achieve your destiny.' endif endif if %classquest% == 1 wait 2 if %use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sorry little one.  I am already setting up one quest - come back in a moment.' halt endif if %actor.align% < -349 nod %actor.name% if %actor.class% /= Warrior if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do ye wish to join the ranks of the unholy warriors?' set use_subclass Ant elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Strong thirst for slaughter for one so young.  Come back once you've gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif elseif %actor.class% /= Cleric if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do ye wish to join the ranks of the diabolists and derive power from madness and darkness?' set use_subclass Dia elseif msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Strong thirst for madness for one so young.  Come back once you've gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do ye wish to join the ranks of the necromancers and have power over death?' set use_subclass Nec elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Strong thirst for death for one so young.  Come back once you've gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif endif global use_subclass else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Begone, fool.  You are far too righteous to join our brotherhood.' endif endif endif

triggers.name: start_quest_ziijhan
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Cleric && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to diabolist.&0 halt break default set classquest 1 done elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to anti-paladin.&0 halt break default set classquest 1 done elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45 switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to necromancer.&0 halt break default set classquest 1 done endif if %classquest% == 1 if %speech% /= yes if %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% == 0 quest start nec_dia_ant_subclass %actor.name% %use_subclass% endif unset use_subclass wait 2 nod msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Only the most cunning and strong will complete the &5quest&0 I set before you.  I shall take great pleasure in your demise, but I will offer great rewards for your success.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can update you on your &5[subclass progress]&0 as well.' elseif %speech% /= no unset use_subclass msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Begone from my sight before I lose patience with you!' whap %actor.name% msend %actor% Ziijhan waves his arms in a circle and you are blinded by a flash of light! mechoaround %actor% Ziijhan glares at %actor.name% and sends %actor.o% elsewhere! mteleport %actor% 8501 endif endif

triggers.name: quest_details_ziijhan
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% == 1 quest advance nec_dia_ant_subclass %actor.name% endif wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Many years ago, my pact with the demon realm allowed me to be master of this domain.  All were subjugated, man, woman, and beast.' smirk wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'One man would not bow though!' emote growls with an anger and fury with which many have never seen and lived! wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'My pitiful waste of a &5brother&0 escaped my minions.' smi %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Perhaps you will remedy that.' endif

triggers.name: more_quest_details_ziijhan
triggers.argument_list: brother brother? remedy remedy? how how?
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1  && %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% > 1 if %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% == 2 quest advance nec_dia_ant_subclass %actor.name% endif nod %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes!  My wretched sibling, Ber...  I shall not utter his name!' wait 2 fume wait 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I despise him and his reverent little life.' wait 2 ponder msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'He thinks he is safe now, beyond my grasp.  That FOOL!' chuckle wait 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Enough!  I grow tired of you!' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Bring back proof of the deed and you shall be accepted.' endif

triggers.name: exit_from_ziijhan
triggers.commands: sigh say Sniveling mortal! msend %actor% Ziijhan waves his arms in a circle and you are blinded by a flash of light! mechoaround %actor% Ziijhan glares at %actor.name% and sends %actor.o% elsewhere! mteleport %actor% 8501

triggers.name: give_head_ziijhan
triggers.commands: wait 2 switch %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% case 1 case 2 * not in final stage of quest msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hmmm, jumping the gun a bit aren't we?  I didn't even tell you the quest yet.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Thanks for the gift, weirdo.' break case 3 * somehow they have the head without GETTING it msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hmmm, how did you get this head without GETTING it?' whap %actor.name% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can't abide that sort of foolishness!' break case 4 emote throws back his head and howls devilishly with pleasure. wait 3 shake %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have done me a great service, and earned your place among the truly dark. smi wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Type &1'subclass'&0 to proceed.' quest complete nec_dia_ant_subclass %actor.name% break default msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Well, what a lovely gift, I must stuff it and mount it on my wall.' thank %actor.name% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Shame you weren't performing the quest, you seem to be a nasty piece of work.' done * junk the head mjunk head

triggers.name: head_retrieval
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% == 3 quest advance nec_dia_ant_subclass %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: Ziijhan forgets someone
triggers.commands: if %start_q% == 1 set counter 0 set questerhere 0 set room %get.room[%self.room%]% set person %room.people% while %person% if %person.name% /= %q_plyr% set questerhere 1 endif set person %person.next_in_room% done if %questerhere% == 0 say Hmm, where did %q_plyr% go? set start_q 0 global start_q endif endif

triggers.name: torturer_death
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 2 quest advance resurrection_quest %person.name% set run yes elseif %person.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:new]% == yes quest variable resurrection_quest %person.name% new new set run yes endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 2 quest advance resurrection_quest %person.name% set run yes elseif %person.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:new]% == yes quest variable resurrection_quest %person.name% new new set run yes endif if %run% /= yes m_run_room_trig 8553 endif

triggers.name: seer_speak5

All were subjugated, man, woman, and beast.' smirk wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'One man would not bow though!' emote growls with an anger and fury with which many have never seen and lived! wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'My pitiful waste of a &5brother&0 escaped my minions.' smi %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Perhaps you will remedy that.' break case 3 case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'My wretched sibling, Ber...  I shall not utter his name!' wait 2 fume wait 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I despise him and his reverent little life.' wait 2 ponder msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'He thinks he is safe now, beyond my grasp.  That FOOL!' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Bring back proof of the deed and you shall be accepted.' break default if %actor.align% < -349 if %actor.class% /= Warrior && %actor.level% <= 25 switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 25 done elseif %actor.class% /= Cleric && %actor.level% <= 35 switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 35 done elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer && %actor.level% <= 45 switch %actor.race% case elf case faerie_seelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes done endif endif if %classgreet% == yes if %actor.level% >= 10 peer %actor.name% emote places a most vile half-smile on his face. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Shame you aren't performing this quest, you seem to be a nasty piece of work.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Come back when you have a few more kills, you seem to be a nasty piece of work.' endif else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You don't work for me and you probably never will.' endif done

triggers.name: Ziijhan general receive
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case %maceitem2% case %maceitem3% case %maceitem4% case %maceitem5% case %macevnum% halt break default set response What is this garbage? done if %response% return 0 msend %actor%%self.name% scoffs at %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, '%response%' endif

triggers.name: Resurrect_greet
triggers.commands: wait 1 if %actor.class% == cleric || %actor.class% == priest || %actor.class% == diabolist if %actor.level% < 81 wait 1s say You've done well for yourself, little one.  Come back when you are stronger and perhaps I'll have something for you. pat %actor.name% elseif %actor.level% < 100 if %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:new]% /= new say I've heard what happened.  Ziijhan will be furious! cackle wait 2s roll say Fine, I suppose I can help you. wait 1s emote pulls another talisman from his robes. wait 1s mload obj 8550 give talisman %actor% elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% < 1 smile say What brings a young cleric to my home?  Has your order sent you to steal my books again?  Or could it be that your order has forgotten how the resurrection incantations are to be performed? elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 3 wait 1 s grin %actor% wait 3s say I've heard what happened.  Ziijhan will be furious! cackle wait 4s ponder say Perhaps you could be useful to me after all. halt endif else Say Come to steal my books again?!  You will not learn the art of resurrection by arcane magic.  You will only become an abomination like myself.  Go seek out the divine arts. wait 2s say NOW LEAVE OR ATTACK ME, IF YOU DARE! endif endif

triggers.name: norisent speech
triggers.argument_list: resurrection teach resurrect yes  payment how how? please useful command souls
triggers.commands: set speech %speech% if %actor.vnum% /= -1 if %actor.class% == cleric || %actor.class% == priest || %actor.class% == diabolist if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% <= 1 || %actor.level% >= 81 if %speech% /= resurrection || %speech% /= resurrection? quest start resurrection_quest %actor.name% wait 1s emote smirks ever so slightly, with a creepy glint of foreboding. say So it's happened.  I knew someday your order would forget how.  Though, it's happened much sooner than I would have thought.  It only took a thousand years. emote furrows his brow. wait 1s say Is this true?  Have you come hoping that I will teach you how to resurrect your allies? halt endif endif if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% /= 1 if %speech% /= teach ||  %speech% /= resurrect || %speech% /= yes wait 1s say And what could you possibly offer me as payment?  I require nothing of food or drink.  Riches and knowledge are mine.  Glory and honor are lost on me.  I owe no living man my loyalty. wait 3s say 'I know of only one thing that would please me more than your death that I might consider payment. halt elseif %speech% /= payment || %speech% /= please wait 1s say There is an emissary from the Abbey of St. George, a bishop, being held in the dungeon.  Ziijhan would have her tortured and killed.  He's always trying to settle an old score with his brother, Barak. wait 3s say The old knight is being a petty child, but what could you possibly do to upset him?  Be gone, and trouble me no more. quest advance resurrection_quest %actor% halt endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% /= 3 if %speech% /= useful || %speech% /= how || %speech% /= how? quest advance resurrection_quest %actor.name% wait 1s say Yes, there is something more you could do for me. wait 1s say A beastly dark mage left an experiment... unresolved.  Very unprofessional of him. wait 3s say In his attempts to reunite a body and soul, he left them each alive, severed from one another. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'You must go and find Lajon's two severed halves, loose them of their undead states, and then destroy them both.  The soul must be rebuked with the words of power &4&bDhewsost Konre&0, before purging him.' wait 5s say To purge the rogue body, however, you'll need to give him this to help you finalize his death. wait 4s mload obj 8550 give death %actor% wait 3s say And as for the old mage... chuckle wait 2s say That talisman should aid his passing as well.  The ring of souls is the source of his power.  Bring it to me when you're finished. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'And if you forget, you can ask about your &7&b[progress]&0.  Maybe I'll consider reminding you.' endif endif endif endif

triggers.name: Torturer_death_resurrect_quest
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.class% == cleric || %actor.class% == priest || %actor.class% == diabolist if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 2 mload obj 8504 endif endif endif

triggers.name: bishop room trig
triggers.commands: wait 1s wforce bishop abort wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[8514]% says, 'You've done it!  Norisent must have sent you.  He has great admiration for those of us who dedicate ourselves to restoration magic.  He's sure to be pleased to hear of your involvement.' wait 3s wforce bishop say I must go now, while I have a chance.  Thank you so much! wait 3s wforce bishop abort wecho The bishop starts casting &3&b'word of recall'&0... wecho The bishop completes her spell. wecho The bishop closes her eyes and utters the words, 'word of recall'. wecho the bishop vanishes in a flash of light. wpurge bishop

triggers.name: Resurrection Death Talisman Give
triggers.commands: * As mobs are handed this object, they are recorded on the object itself as a global, * Then when it's turned in to Norisent, he checks the object for the appropriate global variables. * * If the item has been assigned to a quester, it does its tricks, otherwise it skips to the bottom. switch %victim.vnum% case 8550 if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% > 10 oecho %victim.name% mutters an incantation and %self.shortdesc% bursts into flame and is gone. opurge %self% halt endif switch %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% case 4 if !%actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:4003]% oforce %victim% say You have not banished Lajon's Soul. elseif %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:4004]% == 0 oforce %victim% say You have not destroyed Lajon's Corruption. elseif %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:4016]% == 0 oecho %victim.name% says, 'You must still stop the one responsible, the Tres Keeper, and return his ring of souls.' else quest advance resurrection_quest %actor% oforce %victim% say Well done.  Now the ring? endif break case 5 oforce %victim% say I need to have that ring. break case 6 if %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:53411]% < 2 oforce %victim% say You have not yet removed enough of the Xeg-Yi from this realm. elseif %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:53308]% == 0 oecho %victim.name% says, 'Aelfric is still out there, with the white robes.  Go finish the job!' else quest advance resurrection_quest %actor% oforce %victim% say Well done.  Now the robes? endif break case 7 oforce %victim% say Before we may continue, I must have the dragon robes. break case 8 if %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:53001]% == 0 oforce %victim% say The spectral man is still out there.  Why are you here? elseif %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:51005]% == 0 oforce %victim% say The poor man's bloody remains must be dispelled.  Go now! elseif %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:51014]% == 0 oecho %victim.name% says, 'Go stop Luchiaans, and bring the source of power before he finds it.' else quest advance resurrection_quest %actor% oecho %victim.name% says, 'Excellent.  And the object of power, do you have it?  Give it to me.' endif break case 9 oforce %victim% say Luchiaans' object of power, do you have it?  Give it to me. break case 10 if %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:52015]% == 0 oforce %victim% say The weaponsmith's spirit still dwells.  Go set her free. elseif %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:52003]% == 0 oecho %victim.name% says, 'The crazed mage must be destroyed.  Go, end this.  Return with his ring.' else quest advance resurrection_quest %actor% oecho %victim.name% mutters an incantation and %self.shortdesc% vanishes into flames, the smoke drifting into %victim.name%'s nostrils. wait 1s oecho %victim.name% says, 'We are nearly finished.  Do you have the mage's artifact of longevity?' opurge self halt endif break default oforce %victim% emote briskly refuses. oforce %victim% say I don't want this from you.  Do not lose that talisman. done return 0 oforce %victim% emote returns the death talisman to you. halt case 4003 case 4004 case 4016 case 53308 case 53001 case 51005 case 51014 case 52015 case 52003 quest variable resurrection_quest %actor% %victim.vnum% 1 break case 53411 if %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:53411]% eval count %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:53411]% + 1 quest variable resurrection_quest %actor% %victim.vnum% %count% else quest variable resurrection_quest %actor% %victim.vnum% 1 endif break default halt done wait 1s oecho %victim.name% feels compelled by %self.shortdesc%. oforce %victim% hold %self% oforce %victim% wear %self% neck

triggers.name: Norisent Receive
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 4008 if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 4 return 0 emote refuses to take it. say First, give me the talisman, to be sure this was done right. halt elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 5 wait 1s mpurge %object% quest advance resurrection_quest %actor.name% say Excellent.  The Tres Keeper was using this ring to gain power over the connection between soul and body.  It should not be in such careless hands as his. wait 3s say Another of the dark mages focused his research on extending life.  He is using robes imbued with the power of a mighty dragon to manipulate the flow of time and extend his life.' sigh wait 3s say However, his tempering with the mysterious time elementals left behind from the Time Cataclysm opened a rift that he could not control.  Monstrous tentacled abominations wriggled through the rift and are now wreaking havoc on the material plane. wait 5s mecho %self.name% says, 'With that talisman, you must remove the &4&btwo Xeg-Yi&0 from this world.  They do not belong.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'When you're finished, remove the &4&bdragon-cult mage&0 by the same means.  His meddling is over.' halt endif halt elseif %object.vnum% == 53307 if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 6 return 0 emote refuses your item. say First, give me the talisman.  I want to be sure things are in order. halt elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 7 wait 1s mpurge %object% quest advance resurrection_quest %actor.name% say Good.  Aelfric's work with lengthening life was disrupting the flow of time itself.  Very foolish of him. wait 3s say There is one whose necromancy has become quite advanced, as brutish as it is. chuckle wait 3s say His works have sunken a castle into the swamps, leaving it to the local lizard men.  But more critically, he is continuing his vulgar practice in a nearby village, severing spirits and bodies, magic and reality, and even losing demons into the world.  The situation is utterly out of his control.  He seeks a relic that he believes will aid him in his research. wait 5s if %actor.class% == diabolist say Help him find the heart of the phoenix that he seeks, but bring it here. else say Find the book he seeks, before he discovers its resting place.  You must bring it to me. endif wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'There is a man that resists the oppressor, with both his &4&bsoul in the castle&0, and his &4&banimated bloody remains&0 in the village where the &4&bdark mage&0 has made his dwelling.' wait 3s say Remove them all!  Dark mage and the bloody abomination by means of the talisman, and the remaining spirit by means of the divine utterance, "Dhewsost Konre." halt endif halt elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 9 && (%object.vnum% == 51023 || %object.vnum% == 51028 || %object.vnum% == 51022) if %object.vnum% == 51023 switch %actor.class% case CLERIC case PRIEST wait 2 mjunk %object% say Ah, the angelic book!  You have done well to keep this from him. quest advance resurrection_quest %actor.name% break case DIABOLIST return 0 say Wrong one, dummy. default return 0 say What's your class? halt done elseif %object.vnum% == 51028 switch %actor.class% case diabolist wait 2 mjunk %object% say Ah, the phoenix heart!  You've done well to keep this from him. quest advance resurrection_quest %actor.name% break case cleric case priest return 0 say Wrong one, dummy. default return 0 say What's your class? halt done elseif %object.vnum% == 51022 switch %actor.class% case CLERIC case PRIEST return 0 say This book is incomplete!  Something has drained its magic!  Fix that and then bring the book back. break case DIABOLIST return 0 say Wrong one, dummy. default return 0 say What's your class? halt done return 0 say This isn't the power Luchiaans seeks.  Go find it. halt endif * * the old version where you had to go to Doom for the quest * *   wait 3s *   say There is another mage trapped by a malevolent god between life and death.  The continued existence of the mighty battlemage, Solek, is the cause of great instability.  Along with him, his compatriot Velocity, named for the speeds she harnessed in life, is bound by the same god in his keep.  Their continued existence as puppets of a cruel god tears at the very fabric of order and structure. *   wait 3s *   say You must find the power to stop Velocity. The utterance will help you.  Bring swift and lasting death to Solek, and return the source of his arcane wisdoms. *elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 10 *   if %object.vnum% == 48906 *      say Give me the talisman first. I must know that Solek is truly dead. *      return 0 *      emote refuses your item. *   endif * wait 3s say There is another mage who has managed to ensconce himself in a place where no living being should be.  As a side effect of making his home at the boundary between the mortal realm and the Nine Hells, he has been driven insane.  He still survives all these centuries later through magic stolen from the elves of old.  Along with him, several souls have been marooned in the city's ruins. wait 5s mecho %self.name% says, 'One in particular, &4&bthe city's weaponsmith&0, cries out for release from her eternal torment.  You must find the power to grant her wish.  The utterance will help you.' wait 5s mecho %self.name% says, 'Bring swift and lasting death to &4&bthe crazed mage&0, and return the source of his arcane longevity.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 10 if %object.vnum% == 52001 say Give me the talisman first.  I must know the crazed mage is truly dead at last. return 0 emote refuses your item. endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% == 11 if %object.vnum% == 52001 wait 2 mpurge %object% say The ring is secure again.  It holds more power than a mortal can imagine. wait 3s say One yet remains of the foolish necromancers, who threatened the very existence of the world with their foolish search for immortality.  End me now, and let this be finished! quest advance resurrection_quest %actor% set complete 1 global complete endif else return 0 wait 1 emote refuses your offering. say This isn't what we're after. endif

triggers.name: ghosts death

triggers.name: Resurrection_quest_grant_spell_get
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% > 10 wait 1s osend %actor% You thumb through the book and find Norisent has taught you all you need to know. oload mob 8551 oforce mob mskillset %actor.name% resurrect wait 2 opurge ai osend %actor% &6&bYou have learned Resurrect.&0 oecho %self.shortdesc% crumbles to dust and blows away. quest complete resurrection_quest %actor.name% if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask5]% && %actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == 2 quest variable hell_trident %actor% helltask5 1 endif opurge %self% endif

triggers.name: resurrection_quest_status_checker
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.has_completed[resurrection_quest]% say You have already learned the secrets of the Resurrection. halt else set stage %actor.quest_stage[resurrection_quest]% switch %stage% case 3 say Do something to interfere with Ziijhan. wait 1s say I hear he has a bishop locked up in the dungeon. halt break case 4 set hunt %get.mob_shortdesc[4004]%, %get.mob_shortdesc[4003]%, and %get.mob_shortdesc[4016]% set mob1 4004 set mob2 4003 set mob3 4016 set item %get.obj_shortdesc[4008]% break case 5 set item %get.obj_shortdesc[4008]% break case 6 set hunt 2 Xeg-Yi and %get.mob_shortdesc[53308]% set mob2 53411 set mob1 53308 set item %get.obj_shortdesc[53307]% break case 7 set item %get.obj_shortdesc[53307]% break case 8 set hunt %get.mob_shortdesc[51005]%, %get.mob_shortdesc[53001]%, and %get.mob_shortdesc[51014]% set mob1 51005 set mob2 53001 set mob3 51014 if %actor.class% /= Cleric || %actor.class% /= Priest set item a large book on healing from Nordus elseif %actor.class% /= Diabolist set item %get.obj_shortdesc[51028]% endif break case 9 if %actor.class% /= Cleric || %actor.class% /= Priest set item a large book on healing from Nordus elseif %actor.class% /= Diabolist set item %get.obj_shortdesc[51028]% endif break case 10 set hunt %get.mob_shortdesc[52003]% and %get.mob_shortdesc[52015]% set mob1 52003 set mob2 52015 set item %get.obj_shortdesc[52001]% break case 11 set item %get.obj_shortdesc[52001]% break default say Did you want to do a quest of some kind?  Because you're not at the moment.  Get lost. done endif if %stage% == 4 || %stage% == 6 || %stage% == 8 || %stage% == 10 set target1 %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:%mob1%]% set target2 %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:%mob2%]% if %stage% == 6 || %stage% == 10 set target3 1 else set target3 %actor.quest_variable[resurrection_quest:%mob3%]% endif say You must eliminate: mecho %hunt% if %stage% == 4 || %stage% == 8 if %target1% && %target2% && %target3% set done 1 endif elseif %stage% == 6 if %target1% && (%target2% == 2) set done 1 endif else if %target1% && %target2% set done 1 endif endif if %done% mecho say You have dispatched them.  Give me the death talisman! halt endif if %target1% || %target2% || %target3% mecho mecho You have destroyed: if %target1% mecho - %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob1%]% endif if %stage% == 6 if %target2% == 2 mecho - %target2% %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob2%]% endif else if %target2% mecho - %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob2%]% endif endif if %stage% == 4 || %stage% == 8 if %target3% mecho - %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob3%]% endif endif endif if (%stage% != 6 && (!%target1% || !%target2% || !%target3%)) || (%stage% == 6 && (!%target1% || %target2% < 2)) mecho mecho You still need to dispatch: if !%target1% mecho - %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob1%]% endif if %stage% == 6 if %target2% < 2 eval xeg (2 - %target2%) mecho - %xeg% %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob2%]% endif else if !%target2% mecho - %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob2%]% endif endif if !%target3% mecho - %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob3%]% endif mecho mecho Return %item% as proof. endif mecho mecho Don't forget the banishment phrase: &4&bDhewsost Konre&0 elseif %stage% == 5 || %stage% == 7 || %stage% == 9 || %stage% == 11 say Bring me back %item%. endif if %stage% >= 4 mecho mecho %self.name% says, 'If you need a new talisman, say &9&b"I need a new talisman"&0.' endif

rooms.name: The Dead Path
rooms.description: A small path winds its way toward an ancient structure.  It looks as if it could be a church of some type, but it is impossible to be sure.  It smells slightly of decaying corpses.

West.description: This strange path continues on to the west

rooms.name: Small Path
rooms.description: This small path continues toward an ancient structure.  It looks as if it could be a church of some type, but it is impossible to be sure.  It smells slightly of decaying corpses.

rooms.name: Before the Gates of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Standing before this HUGE gate, it seems unaffected by time or the elements. The ancient structure is clearly visible through the gate now.  Judging from some strange symbols it would appear to be a place of worship, although it cannot be discerned who or what might have been worshipped here.  The smell that was noticed earlier is back and stronger then ever, as if it eminates from this unholy place.

West.description: A huge gate pulsates in hypnotizing colors.

extras.text: You are dwarfed by this massive gate. It pulsates with color and is made of some material you are totally unfamiliar with. As you reach your hand out and touch the gate, you are surprised that it is ice cold. Then before you can pull your hand away it instantly becomes white-hot. The only thing you are sure of is the craftsmanship is amazing, definitely dwarven in origin.

rooms.name: A Small Graveyard
rooms.description: Only the wind seems to stir in this desolate and forsaken place.  Ancient willows stand as silent mourners forever keeping alive the memories of those who have departed this realm.  There seems to have been a great commotion at one time, tombstones are overturned, and some graves show signs of desecration. There is a strong odor of rotting corpses in the air.

East.description: A large gate of a strange, unknown material lies before you.

extras.text: You are dwarfed by this massive gate. It is jet black in color and made of some material you are totally unfamiliar with. As you reach your hand out and touch the gate, you are surprised that it is ice cold. Then before you can pull your hand away it instantly becomes white-hot. The only thing you are sure of is the craftsmanship is amazing, definitely dwarven in origin.

rooms.name: A Small Graveyard
rooms.description: Only the wind seems to stir in this desolate and forsaken place.  Ancient willows stand as silent mourners forever keeping alive the memories of those who have departed this realm.  There seems to have been a great commotion at one time, tombstones are overturned, and some graves show signs of desecration. There is a strong odor of rotting corpses in the air.

rooms.name: A Small Graveyard
rooms.description: This small graveyard is absolutely ghastly!  Tombstones are overturned, bodies hang lifeless form various trees, and open graves are everywhere.  The putrid smell of rotting corpses is overpowering.  There seems to be a path that may extend around the south side of the Cathedral.

rooms.name: Before the Cathedral
rooms.description: This is truly a marvel in architecture.  A cathedral of pure black rock mined from the very mountains that surround you.  Intricately carved butresses stand like sentinels, providing support for this ancient structure.  Far above your head, a multitude of gargoyles hunch silently, stoicly watching your every move with great interest.  The steps leading up to the Cathedral are here.

rooms.name: A Small Graveyard
rooms.description: Only the wind seems to stir in this desolate and forsaken place.  Ancient willows stand as silent mourners forever keeping alive the memories of those who have departed this realm.  There seems to have been a great commotion at one time, tombstones are overturned, and some graves show signs of desecration. There is a strong odor of rotting corpses in the air.  There seems to be a path that may extend around the north side of the cathedral.

rooms.name: A Small Graveyard
rooms.description: Only the wind seems to stir in this desolate and forsaken place.  Ancient willows stand as silent mourners forever keeping alive the memories of those who have departed this realm.  There seems to have been a great commotion at one time, tombstones are overturned, and some graves show signs of desecration. There is a strong odor of rotting corpses in the air.  Amid this sacrilege one particular tombstone catches your eye.

extras.text: This tombstone has almost been completely destroyed by some unknown person or creature. The only thing you can make out is a partial name, B r  k. Most of the letters are illegible. It appears as something is carved into the back of the tombstone.
You finally manage to turn the tombstone over, piecing together some parts you read: You may have cheated death for now, but I have all eternity. There is more but you can't seen to make it out.

rooms.name: The Grand Entrance
rooms.description: You stand in a vestibule of enormous size and height.  The jet black rock used in this foyer is the same as that used outside, on the cathedral walls. Strange runes are carved into the very rock, and intricately detailed reliefs grace the walls with their hideously contorted faces.  Far above, a beautiful typanum reveals the true genius and talent of the architects involved in the cathedral's construction.

West.description: A huge set of heavy, black, metal doors sits here shining like new.

extras.text: An intricate carving of immense detail. It seems to depict this Cathedral and the surrounding graveyard. The sky as depicted is ripped open and there are demons and lightning flooding down from the heavens. It also appears that there are a pair of huge, evil eyes in the background.

rooms.name: Northeast Corner of Cathedral
rooms.description: This is the north-east corner of this great stone Cathedral.  There are huge jet black blocks that fit together with such precision that their edges are like fine sword blades.  The path appears to end in the rear of the Cathedral, although it is impossible to be sure.  There is an intangible presence or force that plays tricks with the light and shadows.

rooms.name: Along the North Side of the Cathedral
rooms.description: This northern path is quite treacherous.  It has turned very muddy.  Small droplets of blood seem to be the cause of the mud.  It must be seeping in from underground.  The path seems the be well travelled judging from the various tracks.  Some are recognizable, most are not.

rooms.name: Along the North Side of the Cathedral
rooms.description: The mud here- dark, thick, and slimy- is similiar to tar.  Now about one foot in depth, it is slightly difficult to traverse.  The cathedral blocks any attempt at escape to the south, and a large, black, wrought iron fence does the same to the north.

rooms.name: Along the North Side of the Cathedral
rooms.description: The mud here- dark, thick, and slimy- is similiar to tar.  About two feet in depth, movement is extremely difficult.  The cathedral blocks any attempt at escape to the south, and a large, black wrought iron fence does the same to the north.

rooms.name: Northwest Corner of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Standing at this north-west corner of the Cathedral, the gate that gave access to this horrible place seems very distant as if it were miles away. There appears to be a smaller structure a little ways to the south and west.

rooms.name: Behind the Cathedral
rooms.description: The huge shadow cast by the cathedral drowns out all sunlight.  It is impossible to describe how black the church is.  Its silhouette appears no different to the naked eye than in full sunlight.  There is an eerie red glow eminating from the south-west.

rooms.name: Behind the Cathedral
rooms.description: This is straight from children's bedtime tale!  Dark, hunched trees, their branches like fingers, seem poised to grasp at the flesh.  The vines and ivy, wildly growing all over the ground, tangle the feet, making any progress difficult.  Directly to the west a strange fog spews forth from a mausoleum that is glowing dark red.

rooms.name: Behind the Cathedral
rooms.description: The huge shadow cast by the cathedral drowns out all sunlight.  It is impossible to describe how black the church is.  Its silhouette appears no different to the naked eye than in full sunlight.  There is an eerie red glow eminating from the north-west.

rooms.name: SW Corner of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Standing at this south-west corner of the Cathedral, the gate that gave access to this horrible place seems very distant as if it were miles away. There appears to be a smaller structure a little ways to the north and west.

rooms.name: Along the South Side of the Cathedral
rooms.description: This path follows the southern wall of the cathedral.  The path itself is hidden beneath a tangle of weeds, vines, and ivy.  Its almost as if the plants have their own agenda, an agenda that involves the disposal of trespassers. The huge black wall of the church blocks travel to the north, while a large wrought-iron fence blocks passage to the south.

rooms.name: Along the South-Side of the Cathedral
rooms.description: This path follows the southern wall of the cathedral.  The path itself is hidden beneath a tangle of weeds, vines, and ivy.  Its almost as if the plants have their own agenda, an agenda that involves the disposal of trespassers. The huge black wall of the church blocks travel to the north, while a large wrought-iron fence blocks passage to the south.

rooms.name: Along the South-Side of the Cathedral
rooms.description: This path follows the southern wall of the cathedral.  The path itself is itself is hidden beneath a tangle of weeds, vines, and ivy.  Its almost as if have their own agenda, an agenda that involves the disposal of trespassers. Tresspassers.  The huge black wall of the church blocks travel to the north, while a large wrought-iron fence blocks passage to the south.

rooms.name: Southeast Corner of Cathedral
rooms.description: This is the south-east corner of this great stone cathedral.  There are huge jet black blocks that fit together with such precision that their edges are like fine sword blades.  The path appears to end in the rear of the Cathedral, although it is impossible to be sure.  There is an intangible presence or force that plays tricks with the light and shadows.

rooms.name: Outside the Jet Black Mausoleum
rooms.description: Thick, dark fog obscures progress and vision.  A large mausoleum lies to the west, made from a highly polished jet black stone.  It is seamless, as if it were carved from one solid piece of rock.  There appears to be an outline of a door of some sort, but no keyholes or even handles which it could be opened by. There are no other visible entrances.  There is a strong feeling of evil in the air.  Words in some strange language are carved above the entranceway.

extras.text: Yep its an outline. It's the outline of a door. There is no visible way to open it and the veins running through the stone are very strange.
The veins of this rock are not some colored mineral, but actual veins that pulse rhythmically, as blood flows through.
The language is one that you have never seen, yet you know what it says: Know the name of who you seek.

rooms.name: Inside Ziijhan's Mausoleum
rooms.description: This mausoleum is completely unadorned.  In each of the four corners of the room, strange red crystals topped with small flickery black flames glow dimly. In the center of the floor, deeply carved evil runes swirl with sticky-sweet blood.  Five stands rise from the specific points on the floor, each topped with radiating black crystals, topped with small flickery red flames.

rooms.name: The Main Aisle of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Your feet sink deeply into a plush black carpeting with a gold laurel bordering.  Immense pillars of solid marble with veins of pure gold and a multitude of deeply colored gems support a intricatley painted vaulted ceiling, filled with images of battle, death, and icons of grotesque beasts who are obviously not of this plane.  Far down the aisle is the main altar, stunning even from this distance.  High above the altar a clerestory, allows only eerie red light to enter through its crimson colored glass.

East.description: A solid wood double door is here.

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: Somewhat isolated from the main aisle, this side walkway would have offered some privacy during religious ceremonies, but now it only gives a sense of entrapment.  Beautifully carved dark wood pews sit dusty and unused to the north.  Adding to the sense of confinement the ceiling here is quite a bit lower than that above the main promenade, perhaps there is something upstairs. A beautiful stained glass window is here, high above.

extras.text: In this final rendering the glass is mostly black. There is a pair of red demon eyes in the background. In the foreground is the priest, drawn and quartered, his soul is forcibley being extracted from his body. Blood flows from his eyes. It drips down the glass and runs down the wall.
Two letters are carved from gold. --AN

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: Somewhat isolated from the main aisle, this side walkway would have offered some privacy during religious ceremonies, but now it only gives a sense of entrapment.  Beautifully carved dark wood pews sit dusty and unused to the south.  Adding to the sense of confinement the ceiling here is quite a bit lower than that above the main promenade, perhaps there is something upstairs. A beautiful stained glass window is here, high above.

extras.text: The glass starts with a rendering of this church. A solitary man stands at the pulpit, preaching. It appears all is normal. Except for a pair of floating eyes in the background, watching with great interest. A single letter sits atop each of the stained glass windows, carved from solid gold.
A single letter is carved from gold. --Z

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: Somewhat isolated from the main aisle, this side walkway would have offered some privacy during religious ceremonies, but now it only gives a sense of entrapment.  Beautifully carved dark wood pews sit dusty and unused to the south.  Adding to the sense of confinement the ceiling here is quite a bit lower than that above the main promenade, perhaps there is something upstairs. A beautiful stained glass window is here, high above.

extras.text: This next rendering seems to take place on the Observation Balcony you observed, when you entered. The priest from the previous glass seems to be cohorting with some properly dressed individuals. The tone and colors have changed from light to very dark.
A single letter is carved from gold. --I

rooms.name: The Main Aisle of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Magnificent stained glass windows line the north and south walls of this place.  Long lines of dark, wooden, pews also lie to the north and south. Further ahead lies the grand altar which gets more and more disturbing as it is approached.  The crowning statue on the altar seems a little too life-like. Life-like.

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: Somewhat isolated from the main aisle, this side walkway would have offered some privacy during religious ceremonies, but now it only gives a sense of entrapment.  Beautifully carved dark wood pews sit dusty and unused to the north.  Adding to the sense of confinement the ceiling here is quite a bit lower than that above the main promenade, perhaps there is something upstairs. A beautiful stained glass window is here, high above.

extras.text: The next scene shows the priest surrounded by horrid demons, cowering in the corner. The ciborium lies at the feet of a HUGE demon, and some of the red liquid runs out of the corner of his mouth. It is pointing at the priest and laughing. In the background the sky is black and demons and creatures pour down from the sky.
A single letter is carved from gold. --H

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: Somewhat isolated from the main aisle, this side walkway would have offered some privacy during religious ceremonies, but now it only gives a sense of entrapment.  Beautifully carved dark wood pews sit dusty and unused to the north.  Adding to the sense of confinement the ceiling here is quite a bit lower than that above the main promenade, perhaps there is something upstairs. A beautiful stained glass window is here, high above.

extras.text: In this scene, the priest is sharing a meal and drink with fellow priests and some of the properly dressed individuals. You notice the ciborium and other vessels are all filled with the liquid from the fountain. Strangely the shadows cast by the people in the glass are that of demons.
A single letter is carved from gold. --J

rooms.name: The Main Aisle of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Magnificant stained glass windows line the north and south walls of this place.  Long lines of dark, wooden, pews also lie to the north and south. Further ahead lies the grand altar which gets more and more disturbing as it is approached.  The crowning statue on the altar seems a little too life-like. Life-like.

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: Somewhat isolated from the main aisle, this side walkway would have offered some privacy during religious ceremonies, but now it only gives a sense of entrapment.  Beautifully carved dark wood pews sit dusty and unused to the south.  Adding to the sense of confinement the ceiling here is quite a bit lower than that above the main promenade, perhaps there is something upstairs. A beautiful stained glass window is here, high above.

extras.text: The priest from the original is now shown speaking to something that is cloaked in the shadows. In the background is a small ornate fountain and next to it a beautiful ciborium sits, filled with an unknown red liquid.
A single letter is carved from gold. --I

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: The construction of this cathedral herds everything to the focal point, the altar.  A small marble railing prohibits access to the west, the only exits from here seem to be east, or south toward the altar.

rooms.name: The Main Aisle of the Cathedral
rooms.description: Approaching the altar the true size and complexity of it comes into focus. The white marble has assumed a red color from the clerestory above.  There is something draped across the sacrificial table, but it cannot be discerned from this distance.  The crowning statue atop the altar has again shifted its head to follow your movements.  Two side exits, one on each side of the altar, are clearly in view now.

rooms.name: A Smaller Side Aisle
rooms.description: The construction of this cathedral herds everything to the focal point, the altar.  A small marble railing prohibits access to the west, the only exits from here seem to be east, or north toward the altar.

rooms.name: The Sacristy
rooms.description: This small room serves as a store room for holy vestments and vessels. Many bookshelves and storage racks line the walls, containing vast amounts of knowledge and many items of great great value.  A staircase leading up offers a departure to the second floor.

South.description: A very simple, worn, and wobbly bookshelf sits here full of knowledge.

extras.text: A simple, worn bookcase stands here against the wall. With hundreds of titles on the shelf a true intellectual would be happy for years.

rooms.name: The Crimson Altar
rooms.description: This altar must be seventy-five feet high.  Strange statues of demons flank the altar, serving as vigilant and eternal guardians of its upkeep and well-being.  The altar glows deep red in color and upon closer inspection, it can be seen that the clerestory is not solely responsible for this.  There are deep stains in the marble, blood red, that also contribute to this coloration. Two doors can be seen on both sides of this homage to evil.

extras.text: The statue is highly polished marble and beautilully carved. It is the in likeness of the founder of this Cathedral, Ziijhan. The statue seem to have undergone some type of metamorphosis, but not by any physical means. Some unknown power has turned the statue into a frightening humanoid. Its eyes glow blue. It is watching.
Red stained-glass windows grace the clerestory high above. A creepy red light filters down, turning everything in sight blood-red.
A mysterious black cloth, with tiny flecks of gold sparkles as it lies across the table. Its beautiful, but in the same way as an arrow frog is beautiful.

rooms.name: The Sacristy
rooms.description: This small room serves as a store room for holy vestments and vessels. Many bookshelves and storage racks line the walls, containing vast amounts of knowledge and many items of great great value.  A staircase leading up offers a departure to the second floor.

rooms.name: The Confessional
rooms.description: This small room is very plainly decorated.  A simple red carpet covers the ground, and some dark printed silk wallpaper lines the walls.  A small rectangular block of wood sits on the ground, a couple of inches from the wall. This block must have been used as a kneeling block, to plead for forgiveness.

rooms.name: The Confessional -Priest Chamber
rooms.description: Red silken wallpaper and some small works of religious art line the walls here.  Black carpeting, similiar to the that used in the main aisle, is also used in this small confessional.  A small, padded bench sits in its side, on the floor.  It must have been the seat where the priest sat to hear the parishioners confessions.

rooms.name: The Confessional
rooms.description: This small room is very plainly decorated.  A simple red carpet covers the ground, and some dark printed silk wallpaper lines the walls.  A small rectangular block of wood sits on the ground, a couple of inches from the wall. This block must have been used as a kneeling block, to plead for forgiveness.

A small rectangular block of wood sits on the ground, a couple of inches from the wall. This block must have been used as a kneeling block, to plead for forgiveness.

rooms.name: Climbing the Marble Stairs
rooms.description: This small marble staircase must lead to the observation balcony noticeable from below.  The staircase is lined with statues, quietly guarding their realm from their niches.  They are very beautiful, ornate, and so very lifelike.

rooms.name: Climbing the Marble Stairs
rooms.description: This small marble staircase must lead to the observation balcony noticeable from below.  The staircase is lined with statues, quitely guarding their realm from their niches.  They are very beautiful, ornate, and so very lifelike.

rooms.name: Atop the Marble Stairs
rooms.description: From this vantage point, the clerestory and its splendor is clearly evident. Hundreds of panes of glass make this beautiful source of natural light.  Far below, the cathedral takes on a new beauty.  There is something strange about the clerestory, however.

extras.text: The errie light that filters down through the windows above is caused not by red stained glass, but from clear glass coated with a thick film of red blood that flows over them.  You can see it drips down, yet never hits the altar below.

rooms.name: Climbing the Marble Stairs
rooms.description: This small marble staircase must lead to the observation balcony noticeable from below.  The staircase is lined with statues, quitely guarding their realm from their niches.  They are very beautiful, ornate, and so very lifelike.

rooms.name: Atop the Marble Stairs
rooms.description: From this vantage point, the clerestory and its splendor is clearly evident. Hundreds of panes of glass make this beautiful source of natural light.  Far below the cathedral takes on a new beauty.  There is something strange about the clerestory though.

extras.text: The errie light that filters down through the windows above is caused not by red stained glass, but from clear glass coated with a thick film of red blood that flows over them. You can see it drips down, yet never hits the Altar below.

rooms.name: Observation Balcony
rooms.description: A small marble railing borders this balcony to the north and continues easterly, until it apparently comes to a dead end.  There are several very ornate chairs that lie broken, on the ground.  The once beautiful carpet is now severely torn and mildewed.  High rounded windows, to the south, extends from ceiling to the floor.  It seems to be slightly darker here.

rooms.name: Observation Balcony
rooms.description: A small marble railing borders this balcony to the south and continues east, until it apparently comes to a dead end.  There are several very ornate chairs that lie broken on the ground.  The once beautiful carpet is now severely torn and mildewed.  High rounded windows, to the north, extend from ceiling to the floor.  It seems to be slightly darker here than in previous rooms.

rooms.name: Observation Balcony
rooms.description: A small marble railing borders this balcony to the south and continues east, until it apparently comes to a dead end.  There are several very ornate chairs that lie broken on the ground.  The once beautiful carpet is now severely torn and mildewed.  High rounded windows, to the north, extend from ceiling to the floor.  One thing is for sure, it is getting progressively darker.

rooms.name: Observation Balcony
rooms.description: The balcony comes to an abrupt dead end here.  The windows here have been painted over with a dark colored substance.  Dark purple and black tapestries hang on the walls, making this part of the balcony very dark.  The carpet is heavily mildewed, filling your nostrils with the musty smell of age and decay. Some unknown force leeches the power from your lightsource.

East.description: At first glance you don't notice anything out of the ordinary.

rooms.name: Observation Balcony
rooms.description: A small marble railing borders this balcony to the south and continues easterly, until it apparently comes to a dead end.  There are several very ornate chairs that lie broken, on the ground.  The once beautiful carpet is now severely torn and mildewed.  High rounded windows, to the north, extend from ceiling to the floor.  It seems to be slightly darker here.

rooms.description: The balcony comes to an abrupt dead end here.  The windows here have been painted over with a dark colored substance.  Dark purple and black tapestries hang on the walls, making this part of the balcony very dark.  The carpet is heavily mildewed, filling your nostrils with the musty smell of age and decay. Some unknown force leeches the power from your lightsource.

rooms.name: Secret Library
rooms.description: The library is long but not very wide the north and south walls are covered with books and scrolls.  The walls are black with soot and while this once was an impressive and vibrant library it looks dead.  All the furniture lay here broken.  The carpet is heavily mildewed and torn.  In fact the only thing that doesn't look broken are the books.  A strange power leeches the light from the torches.

rooms.name: Secret Study
rooms.description: The room is ancient the desk is covered with books and scrolls.  The windows have been blacked out.  The torch light is leeched here just like the rest of the Cathedral.  The very source of the dark power seems to pulsate from this place.  The walls are scrawled in ancient script powerful magic is rests in this room.  It seems this study has become more of a lair of dark power then a mages arcane place of learning.

rooms.name: A Chilly Staircase
rooms.description: This hidden staircase is rickety and could collapse and any moment.  It is also quite cold.  It would seem that this part was an original part of the Cathedral's plan.  The walls are lined with silk wallpaper, portraits of ex-bishops line the walls, and metal lanterns are here, although unlit.  A good guess would say these stairs lead to the rectory.  Statues line the walls in their niches.

rooms.name: Descending the Chilly Steps
rooms.description: The entrance to the rectory is directly below.  A strange sweet smell rises in the stairwell.  More statues line the walls, recessed in their alcoves.

rooms.name: A Blood Soaked Floor
rooms.description: One cannot not begin to imagine the forces that are responsible for the slaughter that must have taken place here so many years ago.  Blood seeps up from underground, making the floor very tricky to traverse.  There must have been a great deal of killing and suffering at one time to have all this blood still seep up from the ground.

rooms.name: T-Crossing
rooms.description: What was once place of peace and rest has been turned into a place of death and torture.  What was to be the rectory has been converted to an undercroft, and a torture chamber.  Strange instruments of torture line the walls, along with a weapons rack.  The cells are to the east, while a thick wall of mist blocks any vision to the south.

South.description: A thick fog impairs your vision to the south.

rooms.name: Dead End
rooms.description: This hall looks like at one time it may have continued southward.  The wall to the south is of a different building material then the rest of this area. The walls are cold, solid, stones slightly moist from the humidity.

rooms.name: A Torture Cell
rooms.description: Skulls and various body parts decorate this room, as symbols of the atrocities committed here.  Screams can still be heard throughout this gods-forsaken undercroft.  The blood seems to get more shallow to the east, and a raised platform can be seen there.

rooms.name: Corridor of Blood
rooms.description: The sickening sweet smell of blood is everywhere.  Several entrances to torture rooms are scattered about here.  The thick metal doors seem to be ripped off their hinges and are tossed around the rooms.  Creatures can be heard moving through the darkness.

rooms.name: The Torture Platform
rooms.description: Instruments of torture and entrails line the walls of this damned room. The smell is almost unbearable.  Rats nibble on small bits of flesh.  The screams of the dying echo in your head.  The stimulus is overwhelming.  There are several skeletons and limbs still shackled to wall still quaking in fear of what is their eternal punishment.

rooms.name: Torture Cell
rooms.description: Skulls and various body parts decorate this room, as symbols of the atrocities committed here.  Screams can still be heard throughout this gods-forsaken undercroft.  The blood seems to get more shallow to the east, and a raised platform can be seen there.

rooms.description: The sickening sweet smell of blood is everywhere.  Several entrances to torture rooms are scattered about here.  The thick metal doors seem to be ripped off their hinges and are tossed around the rooms.  Creatures can be heard moving through the darkness.

extras.text: It is in the shape of a cross and crescent moon. It looks like something could fit inside of it.
Several symbols cover the wall here. The are all raised off the wall except one, which is more like an mold or and indentation.

rooms.name: A Torture Cell
rooms.description: Skulls and various body parts decorate this room, as symbols of the atrocities committed here.  Screams can still be heard throughout this gods-forsaken undercroft.  The blood seems to get more shallow to the east, and a raised platform can be seen there.

rooms.name: A Secret Corridor
rooms.description: This secret corridor must have been created by magical means.  The ceiling and walls are extremely rough to the touch.  It seems as though this passage was made by somehow melting through solid rock.  Thick beads of solidified magma cling the ceiling of the tunnel like stalactites.  The floor though has been smoothed out somehow, and is quite slippery.  In the distance the rattling of chains and the screams of a woman can be heard.

West.description: A heavy stone wall is here.

rooms.name: A Secret Corridor
rooms.description: This secret corridor must have been created by magical means.  The ceiling and walls are extremely rough to the touch.  It seems as though this passage was made by somehow melting through solid rock.  Thick beads of solidified magma cling the ceiling of the tunnel like stalactites.  The floor though has been smoothed out somehow, and is quite slippery.  To the south the rattling of of chains and the screams of a woman can be heard.  It all of the sudden seems very cold.

rooms.name: The Torturer's Crimson Apse
rooms.description: This semicircular room was designed for the purpose of torture and execution.  The entire room is very cold, and has an extremely sickening smell. Various instruments of torment hang on the walls, along with brightly burning torches.  The floor has several large stains, and the ceiling has four ropes hinged at the corners of the room.  This is used for drawing and quartering victims.

rooms.name: Dead Silence
rooms.description: The only light here comes from a raised stone pool stands in the center of this room.  It appears to be full of a glowing, azure substance.  There are no other decorations visible.  The only obvious exit is up.

rooms.name: Partially Up a Tower
rooms.description: This tower is dark and fairly damp.  There is a wave of mist floating in one small place in the air, and apparently no wind running up or down.  There is a small crack running on the floor between staircases up and back down.

rooms.name: High in a Tower
rooms.description: The walls are black with small spots of red and brown staining them.  They are fitted tightly together, allowing nothing, air or otherwise, to seep between them.  There is a small ledge on one side of the spiral staircase just above the small landing.  The stairs continue up and down again.

rooms.name: The Top of a Tower
rooms.description: The top of this tower is built nicely, the bricks all fit well together. There is a lone window looking off to the east, from which the Eldorian Foothills are distantly visible.  The black rock on the tower seems to make the view always dim, and it is quiet dank.  For some reason there is no breeze, even though there is an open window.
